findings.title: Known Security Issues and Attack Vectors
findings.description: The code is vulnerable to known security issues and attack vectors as listed on https://github.com/runtimeverification/verified-smart-contracts/wiki/List-of-Security-Vulnerabilities.

findings.title: Intended Behavior and Invariants of Contracts Under Review
findings.description: The report outlines the intended behavior and invariants of the contracts under review, including properties that should be satisfied by the contract at all times.

findings.title: Lesser Concerns, Deviations from Best Practice and Other Weaknesses
findings.description: The code differs from best practice and has other weaknesses.

findings.title: Informative findings # B01: Missing check that permit spender has the BURNER_ROLE
findings.description: The function `burnFromWithPermit` does not check if the spender has the `BURNER_ROLE`, allowing a different permit to be consumed and burn tokens based on prior allowance.

findings.title: B04: A BLOCKED address can still perform some operations
findings.description: A `BLOCKED` address can still perform some operations that change the state of the contract, such as: `approve`, `permit` and `transferFrom` between two addresses that are not its own.
